0.Pros: Fairly easy once you memorize all of the reports and responsibilities you have.
0.Cons: Rude coworkers, crappy vacation hours, no time and a half for holidays, no weekends off

1.Pros: There really is nothing positive at all

2.Pros: Lots of hours, quick moving up
2.Cons: little job security and sketchy promoting practices, bad training

3.Pros: McDonald's has a great training program available that teaches you a variety of skills that are easily transferable to any job. The benefits package, profit sharing and bonus structure are definitely a bonus.
3.Cons: The culture is toxic and is based too much on relationships and not enough on talent. People have worked there for their entire lives and they are resistant to new people and more importantly to new ideas. They keep recycling the same underperformers throughout the company to different roles.

4.Pros: I learn alot from McDonald's and how to be a team player
4.Cons: you just had to work hard and make sure the guess is happy

5.Pros: - Perfect for learning basic time management and customer service skills
5.Cons: - Much bureaucracy, often unclean work environment

6.Pros: You can connect with other people & find them to he really interesting. Also a lot of them are funny
6.Cons: Dealing with so much negativity and rudeness from customers. Having to deal with fake co workers. Managers not liking you because theyre racist

7.Pros: Decent amount of pay for very easy work, free food every now and then when the manager was feeling nice.
7.Cons: During high-traffic hours, people could get impatient and things could go badly very quickly. Have to learn to be patient and not to get involved into any conflicts.

8.Pros: Great culture and work environment. I enjoy working with my GM and Area Supervisor
8.Cons: I have none at this time

9.Summary: "You know what you're getting yourself into"
9.Pros: Worked here over the summer. They are always hiring which is a plus.
9.Cons: Cut my hours when I put in my two weeks
